comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newlyn "Newlyn harbour is the largest fishing port in England." It is in the far southwest, near Penzance. Recent view at motorboatsmonthly.media.ipcdigital.co.uk/9091|00000365d|9181_Newlyn-Harbour.jpg

comment.author: 12503706@N08
comment._content: This is the view looking east, towards Penzance (Cornish: Pensans).  Already famous as a fishing port, Newlyn became a fundamental reference point for the Primary Triangulation of the British Isles, when the Ordnance Survey established a Tidal Observatory here in 1915.  It has since become the reference datum for "Mean Sea Level" for all elevation data in the UK.
